novel.summary: Open this novel to learn about wortomat

chapter_1.name: Welcome üëã
chapter_1.summary: Some tipps to get you started
chapter_1.content:
You are here, which means - you decided to write your very own novel! Congratulations for that! üéâ

The following chapters will give you a small tour of what you can do.

üëâ Let's go!

In the chapter list, select the next chapter to proceed!

üí° By the way: You can select multiple items by using the Shift or Ctrl Key while clicking on an item.

chapter_2.name: How chapters are organized ‚ûï
chapter_2.content:
You may already have noticed the tab menu on top of the application and seen that wortomat gives you space for organizing your chapters, characters, research and locations.

All of these items are organized into groups, e.g. a part consists of multiple chapters.

üëâ Create a new part

To create new part, click on the big plus button in the side menu.

üëâ Rename the part

You see the placeholder text where the name of the new part should be? Click on it, and give your new part some nice title.

üí° You can also use enter and escape keys for confirming or canceling your changes.

üëâ Create a new chapter within the new part

To add a new chapter click on the plus button next to the part name. The new chapter will automatically be selected, so make sure to come back here afterwards üòâ

üëâ Delete the part

Drag and drop parts or chapters on the trash can in the side menu if you want to delete them.

.

chapter_3.name: Renaming and editing üñäÔ∏è
chapter_3.content:
You maybe already noticed that each chapter has

  • A title

  • A summary

  • Tags

  • The content

The chapter you are currently reading does not have a summary or any tags yet - you just see some placeholder text instead.

üëâ Edit the summary

Click on the placeholder text for the summary and give it some nice summary.

üëâ Add a tag

Click on the placeholder text for the tags and add the tag TutorialYou can also create a new tag just by typing it into the field

üëâ Explore the content editor

Click on the content (the thing you are currently reading) and have a look around at what you can do in the text editor

chapter_1.name: Using tags
chapter_1.content:
In the previous chapters, you already learned about the usage of tags.

Tags can help you to focus on what is currently important for you.

Let's say 'Frodo and Sam hike to Mordor' would be one plotline in Lord of the rings and 'The other guys defend Helm's Klamm' would be another plotline.

Tolkien could have tagged all the Frodo-and-Sam chapters with 'Hike to Mordor' and the other chapters with 'Defending Helm's Klamm'.

Whenever he was focussing on the 'Hike to Mordor' he could easily hide all the other chapters so they don't distract him from his current work.

üëâ Add a new tag 'staying-focused'

Add a new tag to the current chapter by clicking on the existing tag. Just type the name of the new tag ('staying-focused') and use the Add new item link.

üëâ Filter for tag 'staying-focused'

Open the filter menu in the side menu and activate the tag filter. Select the 'staying-focused' tag and confirm.

See how all the getting-started chapters are hidden now?

üëâ Deactivate the filter again

Now deactivate the tag filter again so all chapters are visible again.

chapter_2.name: Adding status markers
chapter_2.content:
I don't know about you, but when I am working on my novel, ideas or doubts come up all the time and distract me from what I am currently working on. You can either write it on some piece of paper so it does not get lost or you just put it directly in your chapter where it matters and mark it as a TODO üòå

You can set such status markers anywhere in your content, like this:

TODO: Explain that there are three types of status markers, namely TODO, FIXME and IDEA.

You see the number of status markers in your chapter list, and you can also filter for open todo items.

üëâ Set a status marker

Mark some content in this text and highlight it as a TODO

üëâ Filter for TODO items

Open the filter menu in the side menu and activate the status filter - filter for TODOs only. You will now only see one chapter, because this chapter is the only chapter having a TODO status marker!

üëâ Deactivate the filter again

Deactivate the status filter so you can see all chapters again.

chapter_3.name: Seeing the tree or the forest
chapter_3.content:
Sometimes you just need to take a step back. Getting an overview about what is happening in your novel. For this case, you can activate and deactivate specific parts of the view.

üëâ Hide the content

Open the display menu and toggle the Show content button.

üëâ Show the extended summary

You probably noticed that there are some additional display options that are disabled by default. The extended summary might come in handy if you want to export a resume for your novel.

chapter_1.name: Support and contribute
chapter_1.content:
If you need support, head over to github and leave an issue. But please keep in mind that I am doing all this in my free time.

Any support is appreciated. If you want to contribute (development, translations, ideas, UI improvements...) please also leave an issue on github.
